title: [Large-scale] Mixed Reality-based Medical Procedure Skill Acquisition Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and simple medical procedures
context.additional_context: Learners practice in mixed reality environments using personal BYOD devices compatible with Microsoft HoloLens 2, combining twice-weekly 90-minute real-time lectures with weekly self-directed study; formative assessments are conducted through real-time feedback and quizzes at each learning stage

learning_goals: Perform basic medical knot-tying techniques with over 85% accuracy in a mixed-reality environment.
Apply strategies to reduce cognitive load factors by over 30% during medical procedures.
Achieve standard procedure compliance in over 3 out of 4 attempts in simulations mimicking real clinical environments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
